The course is well-organized and informative. The instructor offers detailed notes and instructions for reviewing. The course assignments cover many important topics in the class and enhances understanding of these concepts. However, sometimes the assignments do not synchronize very well with the progress of the lecture and can be improved.
The rules of the assignments are too strict.
The professor spent a lot of time preparing the course content. It's well designed. I think in general it's very good and there's no obvious weakness.
N/A

The course is very organized and you can learn things through assignments.

The lectures can be more engaging.
good, slides are clear and organized. professor is very engaged
The assignments helped a lot for understanding the material.

Strengths : Learned a lot of C++ semantics
Weakness : The assignments could have been more flexible instead of telling us what exactly to do. It would be better if the professor could leave more design issues for us.
Yes. It is a fundamental course for computer programming and also provides much useful programming experience.
Yes
Yes. This course teaches me how to use C++ in a correct manner. In addition, I get a chance to practice it, it's worthwhile.

Yes.
yes. good to learn c++ in depth
Yes, because the material of the course is quite helpful for someone who wants to be strong in programming and c++ is absolutely an interesting programming language.

If you haven't learned C++ before and want to learn some C++, this course is a good choice. There are some unique features in C++ that are not present in other programming languages.
If you simply want to learn OOP, I would say that this course, especially the homework, is more about C++ itself than about OOP.
